Tasktypes.navigationtasksDescription: Navigation tasks direct the player to new locations.
Tasktypes.thematictasksDescription: Thematic tasks are location-specific tasks with different thematic content.
Tasktypes.informationDescription: The 'information' module can be used to give the player hints and tips.
Tasktypes.navtoflagDescription: In navigation-to-a-flag tasks, the player sees a flag on the map that marks a destination. His/her job is to go to this place.
Tasktypes.navwitharrowDescription: Navigation-with-arrow is a navigation with arrow and distance information, which shows the player the direction to the next destination. The map is not visible.
Tasktypes.navviatextDescription: In a navigation-via-text task, the player receives precise navigation instructions to the next destination.
Tasktypes.navviaphotoDescription: The task type navigation-via-photo navigates the player to the next destination using a photo.
Tasktypes.selflocDescription: With self-location tasks the player has to find his/her current location on the map.
Tasktypes.objectlocDescription: The object-location task type includes the assignment of objects on the map to objects in the environment and vice versa.
Tasktypes.directiondetermDescription: In direction-determination tasks, the player must relate his view-direction with the map alignment.
Tasktypes.freetasksDescription: In free tasks, question and answer types of the task can be freely combined. In this way, for example, quizzes and thematic tasks can be asked.

Mapfeatures.init: at the beginning of the task

Info.title: Information about GeoGami
Info.infotext1: GeoGami is an app for creating and playing map-based games and is particularly suitable for use in educational institutions. The app is scientifically supported and didactically designed by the Institute for Geoinformatics at the University of MÃ¼nster.
Info.infotext2: The focus of GeoGami is on fostering navigational map-reading competencies. Game users can choose between appropriate task types and support their players by turning on and off map features. GeoGami is also suitable for creating thematic games, rallies and digital excursions.
Info.infotext3: You can find more information on our

PlayGame.virtualWorldDescription: Play GeoGami in a virtual world.
PlayGame.correctLocation: Are you exactly right? Then press 'okay'!
PlayGame.shareDataAgreement: I agree that collected data can be processed in aggregate form for research purposes.
PlayGame.emptyGamesList: You haven't created a game yet!
PlayGame.deleteGameMsg: Are you sure you want to delete this game?

Showroom.tasktypesDescription: Get to know the task types.

User.deleteAccountMsg: Are you sure you want to delete your account?
User.enterEmail: Enter your email address and we'll send you an email to reset your password.
User.enterVirCode: Verification code has been sent to {{email}}. Please enter the code below along with your new password.

Popover.chooseComponent: Tap on the buttons to learn more about the task types.
Popover.showFeedback: Should the player receive feedback on whether the task was solved correctly?
Popover.gameArea: Should the game be limited to a map section?
Popover.leaveGameArea: Should a warning be displayed to the player when leaving the marked area?
Popover.outlinedGameArea: Should the selected map section be displayed outlined in the game?
Popover.invisibleGameArea: Should the selected map section not be displayed in the game?
Popover.searchArea: Mark a search area to be displayed to the player as support.
Popover.markLocation: Tap on the map to set a location.
Popover.confirmLocation: Should the player confirm the arrival at the destination with 'Okay'?
Popover.showFlag: Should a destination flag be displayed on the map?
Popover.severalAttempts: May the player try to improve if the task was solved incorrectly?
Popover.keepFlag: Should the destination flag continue to be displayed after the task has been solved?
Popover.accuracy: Set the accuracy to >10m if the marked location is near tall buildings or dense tree canopies, or if you want to allow a larger area as the correct solution.
Popover.flag: This destination is indicated in the game with a flag on the map.
Popover.photoMC: Choose a photo for the correct solution. Also choose three other photos that do not match the correct solution.
Popover.textMC: Write the correct solution in the green box. Write incorrect answers in the red boxes.
Popover.number: Write the correct solution (number) in the box.
Popover.photo: This photo will be displayed in the game.
Popover.gameConnectionInfo: Create a five-digit connection code (numbers/letters), then open GeoGami virtual env. App and enter the code.
Popover.markdown:
Markdown elements can be used.
**example** for bold text.
_example_ for italic text.
~~example~~ for strike through text.
[example link](https://example.com/) for a link.
Further information: https://jfcere.github.io/ngx-markdown/cheat-sheet
Popover.taskInstruction: This task instruction is displayed in the game.
Popover.navInstruction: Add a detailed description of the route here. This will be displayed in the game.
Popover.audioMessage: Click the button to record an audio message or read out the task.
Popover.objectLocation: Select the object to be searched. To do this, click on the small square, outline the object with several clicks and tap on the last selected point to confirm the selection.
Popover.markedMap: The map marker is displayed to the player with the task.
Popover.objectPhoto: Include a photo of the object to be searched. It will be displayed in the game.
Popover.destinationDirection: Mark the direction to be searched on the map. First select the location and then the view direction.
Popover.directionMap: Mark the direction to be searched on the map. First select the location and then the view direction. The marker will be displayed in the game.
Popover.photoDirection: Choose a photo that represents the view direction to be searched.
Popover.showMappingView: When should the player's mapping be displayed on the map?
Popover.showTrack: When should the player's track be displayed on the map?

Feedback.setPoint: Please set a point on the map first
Feedback.setLineofsight: Please set your viewing direction first
Feedback.distanceFromDistanation1: You are {{distance}} m away from the destination.

QuestionText.lookForSThingTakePhoto: Search [...] near you. Take a photo.
QuestionText.turnDirectionChoosePhoto: Turn to the direction you see on the map. Choose the appropriate photo.

QuestionText.whereAreYouLooking: Where are you looking now? Mark your viewing-direction on the map..
QuestionText.turnDirectionPhoto: Turn in the direction of the photo. Mark your viewing-direction on the map.

QuestionType.byMarkingDirectionOnMap: ... by marking the direction on the map
